What does the `proofprotocol` setting control when defining a new currency with Verus?

The `proofprotocol` setting controls who can mint new coins in the currency. In this example, `proofprotocol` is set to 2, which is `PROOF_CHAINID`. This means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
## Testnet Reset Instructions
**Please delete the following directories before launching the testnet:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/VRSCTEST
~/.verustest
```
How can I mint new coins in a currency I created with Verus?

To mint new coins in a currency you created with Verus, you can use the `sendcurrency` command with the `mintnew` option. For example:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
This command mints 10,000 new coins in the "mycoin" currency and sends them to the address "mike@".

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```

What do I need to do to reset the Verus testnet?

To reset the Verus testnet, you need to delete the following directories:
```
~/.komodo/VRSCTEST
~/.verustest
```
This will remove any existing testnet data and allow you to start fresh.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
